alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Blount; Grainger; Jefferson; Knox; Loudon; Roane; Sevier; Union (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 02 at 1:44AM CST until March 02 at 2:45AM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL ANDERSON, NORTHWESTERN BLOUNT, SOUTHWESTERN GRAINGER, CENTRAL JEFFERSON, KNOX, NORTHEASTERN LOUDON, EAST CENTRAL ROANE, NORTHWESTERN SEVIER AND SOUTHEASTERN UNION COUNTIES... At 244 AM EST, Flooding of creeks and yards has been reported in Karns. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Knoxville, Oak Ridge, Morristown, Sevierville, Lenoir City, Alcoa, Jefferson City, Kingston, Loudon, Dandridge, Rutledge, Farragut, Louisville, White Pine, Plainview, New Market, Rockford, Strawberry Plains, Halls and Blaine. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Anderson; Blount; Grainger; Jefferson; Knox; Loudon; Roane; Sevier; Union
